name: rigidly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a stiff or fixed way, without bending or moving: They sat rigidly in their seats.
often disapproving not willing or able to change according to circumstances: I don't believe that good writing must rigidly follow a set of rules. The screening procedure must be rigidly applied.

rigidly adverb
(STIFFLY)
without bending or being bent; stiffly: The interviewer (= person who might give you a job) would look to see if you're unkempt, if you hold your body rigidly, whether your thoughts flow logically (= if your thinking is reasonable) as you speak.
